data.title: List Of Seven Years' War Battles
data.meta_description: List of every major Seven Years' War battle, including photos, images, or maps of the most famous Seven Years' War battles when available. While it is not a ...
data.text:
The Battle of Beauport, also known as the Battle of Montmorency, fought on 31 July 1759, was an important confrontation between the British and French Armed Forces during the Seven Years' War of the French province of Canada. The attack conducted by the British against the French defense line of Beauport, some five kilometres east of Quebec was checked, and the British soldiers of General James Wolfe retreated with 443 casualties and losses.

The Battle of Breslau was a battle fought on 22 November 1757 during the Seven Years' War. A Prussian army of 28,000 men fought an Austrian army of 84,000 men. The Prussians held off the Austrian attack, losing 6,000 men to the Austrians 5,000 men. But one day later the Prussians beat a retreat. Breslau's garrison surrendered on 25 November 1757.
